snippet: The collection from the photographer Charles M. Conlon, which includes portraits of Ruth, Gehrig and DiMaggio and Ty Cobb’s famous slide into third, is expected to sell for more than $1 million....
abstract: Heritage Auctions is set to sell photographer Charles M Conlon's archive of baseball's golden years, which includes photographs of Ty Cobb, Babe Ruth and many others, in auction that could bring in more than $1 million; proceeds will help settle debts accrued by sports memorabilia dealer and photo archivist John Rogers, who faces $50 million in investor and creditor claims.
lead_paragraph: The collection from the photographer Charles M. Conlon, which includes portraits of Ruth, Gehrig and DiMaggio and Ty Cobb’s famous slide into third, is expected to sell for more than $1 million.

headline.main: Pictures of Baseball’s Golden Era, Yours for a Stack of Green
headline.print_headline: Intimate Portraits of a Golden Era
